arts.ttl: Koopmeiners reflects on Juventus victory: “Very happy with the win, Vlahovic lives for goals”
arts.sum: Juventus midfielder Teun Koopmeiners spoke to the press following the team’s victory against Genoa, sharing his thoughts on the match, his teammates’ performances, and the team’s tactical adjustments. Koopmeiners began by discussing the team’s performance: “In the first half, we controlled the game but didn’t create many chances. The coach changed something in the second half, playing with a forward triangle, and this worked better. When we pushed, we earned a penalty, and then everything became easier.” When asked about his assist to Vlahovic and a missed goal opportunity, Koopmeiners responded with humor: “Both (laughs). arts.ttl: Vlahovic: “If you score, you’re the best; if you don’t, you’re the worst – It’s normal, it’s up to me to respond…..”
arts.sum: Dusan Vlahovic finally found his scoring touch, netting twice in Juventus’ 3-0 victory over Genoa. The Serbian striker addressed the media after the match, discussing his performance and recent criticism. On his double and the team’s performance, Vlahovic said, “The most important thing is that we won and we want to continue like this. Conceicao? He’s just arrived, it takes time to get used to it. He can already speak, but he’s a perfectionist and still speaks Portuguese.” Addressing perceptions of a controversial celebration, he stated, “There’s no problem, people talk. arts.ttl: Juventus manager Thiago Motta praises team’s strength after Genoa victory
arts.sum: Following Juventus’ 3-0 win over Genoa, secured by Vlahovic’s penalty, manager Thiago Motta shared his thoughts on the team’s performance in the post-match interview. Motta began by discussing the match itself: “Apart from the tactical change, I said very little between the first and second half. The players always stay alone for a few minutes and try to tell each other what’s needed. I’m very happy with how those on the bench participated as well.
